results.title: Simvastatin rescues homocysteine-induced apoptosis of osteocytic MLO-Y4 cells by decreasing the expressions of NADPH oxidase 1 and 2.
results.text_hl: These findings indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ prevents the detrimental effects of @CHEMICAL_Homocysteine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006710 @@@Hcy@@@ on the apoptosis of osteocytes by regulating the expressions of @GENE_NOX1 @GENE_237038 @@@Nox1@@@ and @GENE_CYBB @GENE_13058 @@@Nox2@@@, suggesting that statins may be beneficial for preventing @CHEMICAL_Homocysteine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006710 @@@Hcy@@@-induced osteocyte apoptosis and the resulting @<m>DISEASE_Osteoporosis_pseudoglioma_syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536063 @@@bone fragility@@@.

citations.NLM: Takeno A, Kanazawa I, Tanaka K, Notsu M, Yokomoto-Umakoshi M, Sugimoto T. Simvastatin rescues homocysteine-induced apoptosis of osteocytic MLO-Y4 cells by decreasing the expressions of NADPH oxidase 1 and 2. Endocr J. 2016 Apr 25;63(4):389-95. PMID: 26842590
